I grew up in a household where rock and roll was not allowed to be listened to. Imagine that, the early to late 60's, the most dynamic period in the history of music, and being told it was evil. The Beatles were long-haired maggots direct from Beezlebub, according to my father. Instead we listened to Country, with the drinking and cheating and all-around psychosis. Go figure. Yet when he left the house my three sisters and I would quickly change the radio dial and take in the wonderful sounds of Motown and the English invasion and all the other varieties of that period of time, my mother (may she rest in peace) allowing it and being a part of the conspiracy to rebel against authority. It remains a sore spot to this day in my relation with my father, I must honestly and sadly admit.
 
 The premise of this thread, though poorly posited, was immediately recognized by me as coming from that same well. May I only say that of all the things in life to worry about, to teach your loving children, to steer clear of, music is not one of them. Further, let your children have their own music, as you had yours.
